tit.cmt: タイトルなので大文字にしました。

sen.j: 琵琶法師（びわほうし）は平安時代から見られた、琵琶を街中で弾く盲目の僧である。
sen.e: The term "biwa hoshi" represents blind priests who played the biwa (a Japanese lute) in a town, and they first appeared in the Heian period.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代には平家物語を琵琶に合わせて語る平曲が完成。
sen.e: The style called heikyoku, chanting the Heike Monogatari (The Tale of the Heike) to the accompaniment of a biwa, was established in the Kamakura period.

sen.e: In the Kamakura period, they formed two groups: one was moso-biwa (which literally means "a blind priest's biwa"), who mainly chanted the Buddhist scriptures, and the other one was Heike-biwa, who chanted the Heike Monogatari.
